page.title: 01 Boars Hill, Oxford
page.content:
The area round Boars Hill is a typical example of rural England.In the main, the area is covered by agricultural land given over to cereals and pasture which in turn supports a certain amount of livestock,mainly dairy cattle. The eastern part of the area contains extensive woodland consistng of both deciduous and coniferous trees. During the decade 1970/80 hundreds of elm trees were destroyed by Dutch Elm Disease and this changed the landscape enormously. Many tree planting schemes have taken place. Horse Chestnut, sycamore and Ash being the most common replacement.
